page.title: 15BIOGRAPHY
page.content: The{chairman of our governors}has been on the town council for 17 years. Her father was on the council for 30 years. So between them they have seen many changes in Halstead. When she was a little girl she remembered going on a steam train from Halstead to Clacton for half a days visit. That was her only holiday. Now the disused railway line is used as a pony track. She used to come to our school when it was a secondary school. Now it is a primary school. That was during the war and she only came for half days as there were evacuees from London here and there was not enough room for everyone to attend at the same time. In the main street, next to the library, used to be the bus park. Now they are busy building flats on the site.
